meanings.definition: To repair or improve something in a makeshift or hasty way.
meanings.sent1: She vamped up her old bike with colorful stickers.
meanings.sent2: He vamped the broken chair with duct tape.
meanings.sent3: The kids vamped their fort with blankets and pillows for a cozy hideout.
meanings.sent4: The chef vamped up the soup with a sprinkle of fresh herbs.
meanings.sent5: The students vamped their presentation with funny memes to make it more interesting.

meanings.definition: To play a simple, catchy tune on a musical instrument.
meanings.sent1: The musician vamped a cheerful melody on his guitar.
meanings.sent2: She vamped a jazzy tune on the piano during the party.
meanings.sent3: The cat vamped a playful tune on the keyboard, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The birds vamped a sweet melody in the morning, signaling the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The children vamped a catchy song on their toy instruments, creating a joyful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To seduce or exploit someone for personal gain.
meanings.sent1: The con artist vamped the unsuspecting victim with false promises.
meanings.sent2: She vamped her way into getting free drinks at the bar.
meanings.sent3: The fox vamped the rabbit with cunning words to lure it into a trap.
meanings.sent4: The villain vamped the hero's weakness to gain an advantage in the battle.
meanings.sent5: The sly salesman vamped the customers with persuasive tactics to make a sale.
